title: Buoyant force - volume of water in floating jug

content.question: A large, empty plastic jug with mass <math alttext="m sub j" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>m</mi><mi>j</mi></msub></math> and volume <math alttext="V sub j" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>V</mi><mi>j</mi></msub></math> floats in a pool of water, as shown in the figure. If the density of water is <math alttext="rho sub w" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>ρ</mi><mi>w</mi></msub></math>, which of the following expressions is equal to the volume of water <math alttext="V sub w" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>V</mi><mi>w</mi></msub></math> that must be added to the jug so that the top of the jug will be at the level of the water?

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction m sub j over rho sub w" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><msub><mi>m</mi><mi>j</mi></msub><msub><mi>ρ</mi><mi>w</mi></msub></mfrac></math>

<math alttext="the fraction m sub j over rho sub w, end fraction, minus V sub j" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><msub><mi>m</mi><mi>j</mi></msub><msub><mi>ρ</mi><mi>w</mi></msub></mfrac><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mi>j</mi></msub></math>

<math alttext="V sub j minus the fraction m sub j over rho sub w" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>V</mi><mi>j</mi></msub><mo>−</mo><mfrac><msub><mi>m</mi><mi>j</mi></msub><msub><mi>ρ</mi><mi>w</mi></msub></mfrac></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="V sub j minus the fraction m sub j over rho sub w" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>V</mi><mi>j</mi></msub><mo>−</mo><mfrac><msub><mi>m</mi><mi>j</mi></msub><msub><mi>ρ</mi><mi>w</mi></msub></mfrac></math>
